website_summaries.verdict: Asus fits a larger screen and the newest GPU on the block into the slim Zephyrus GX 701, but at the cost of battery life and ergonomics.
pros: One of the first laptops available with the latest Nvidia RTX graphics cards
Incredibly slim and light for a 17-inch gaming laptop
Clever volume scroll wheel and new per-key RGB lighting
cons: The touchpad is awkwardly shifted off to the right side
When gaming, the system gets hot and the fans get loud
The vented rear panel may not appeal to everyone

customer_reviews.title: the 16GB memory version runs in dual channel mode, if that matters to you
customer_reviews.text: If you add more memory to this laptop (16GB module or higher), memory will run in single channel mode. This may impact gaming frame rates in certain titles. Overall I'm really happy with this laptop so far, the RTX 2080 MQ is the 90W version and closer to desktop performance vs other RTX 2080 MQ designs out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Texier

customer_reviews.title: Display and G-SYNC options missing
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop! Very fast and looks fantastic. Man, what a beast. However, it appears the Display and G-SYNC options are missing even though this supports G-SYNC. There is even an nVidia G-SYNC sticker on the lower-left corner of the screen. Any ideas as to why this is happening? I have tried new and old drivers from the ASUS website as well as the nVidia site. UPDATE: I have figured it out. I needed to go into "Armoury Crate" (Install this if you haven't already), "Device Configuration" section and enable "GPU Mode". Restart your GX701 and you're good to go. See last Picture.
customer_reviews.author: Phantasm

customer_reviews.title: Best overall high-end laptop I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I run hard Cuda workloads, so I need a fast machine with an NVIDIA GPU. Pop-OS linux installed with zero drama on this machine (I saved the Windows image in case I need it). I also own a Lenovo P72 and a Clevo-Sager 9750, and this machine SMOKES them on Geekbench4 (22k versus 18K and 20K). It's also much prettier, lighter, and all around better. Simply wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Gsync sticker but NO GSYNC
customer_reviews.text: Amazing performance overall. *MISLEADING* Had all the advertising from ASUS website with GSync but it got pulled! Even has a sticker on the laptop. No resolution offered when attempting to reach out to vendor.
customer_reviews.author: TimboSlice

customer_reviews.title: No G-sync
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry I really wanted to like this laptop especially when I pay 3200+ USD and I get a device that doesn’t allow me to use G-sync I did all kind of updates and factory reset but this is how I got the device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monster Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Considering how thin this laptop is, it can be a monster. Set it to gaming mode and boost the CPU and GPU a smidge and this laptop can handle almost anything you throw at it (as long as it's optimized) at the 100+ fps. The draw back give physics and all is that it will get hot and loud when you do that, the heat has to go somewhere but it's easily taken care of with a decent headset.
customer_reviews.author: Senad B.

customer_reviews.title: HDR version of RTX 2080 Max-Q
customer_reviews.text: Hello everyone, Please be aware that RTX 2080 Max-Q is HDR version ( GX701GXH ) that works only in "Optimus" mode, but with HDR. So you will not able to use NVIDIA G-SYNC. ASUS ROG Armory Crate for GX701GXH don't have option to switch between Discrete and Intel graphics cards.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey

customer_reviews.title: WIFI sucks
customer_reviews.text: The computer is great but the wifi sucks. I have to be within 10 feet of my wifi router to get a decent signal. Have to use external antenna when traveling. I have three other working laptops that do much better with the wifi reception. Other than that I love the 144 mghz screen. The video is excellent. I don't use the camera and was glad it wasn't an integral part of the computer. I would have expected better wifi reception with a $2400 computer that doesn't have any type of Cat 5 connection.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and slim for a gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: For a gaming laptop, it is very portable. Runs games like World of Warships or Battlefield V like a champ. It does get pretty hot though when gaming so I am not sure of it’s longevity. Only real complaint is it comes with Macafee software preinstalled and it is almost impossible to uninstall. Otherwise so far really like it
customer_reviews.author: 1Ronin

customer_reviews.title: It's really all that.
customer_reviews.text: I have been blown away with this laptop (if you can call it that). It literally can do what ever, whenever I want. I travel a significant amount for work, and whether I'm editing video or just playing games this laptop never lets me down. It runs everything buttery smooth. The keyboard feels nice, good amount of travel on this thin of a laptop. But the position does lead to me resting my hands on a table or desk... so not so good for the carpal tunnel. The screen though... this thing is a real wonder. The color is amazing. The brightness perfect. I guess you can say, I'm in love with my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Basqueo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Performance but has flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Keeping this short - Overall I love this machine (Fans can get pretty loud on Turbo settings which I advise if the graphics draw is high) But, the keyboard lighting seems to freeze during gaming when GPU power is high. I have to restart the laptop to get the lights to work again. Graphics seize up some during hard gameplay causing some fps issues but really only when it's under a lot of stress. Overall I love the computer but it could use some work. PS - I only game while plugged in. Battery life will not be your best friend! :D
customer_reviews.author: Justin Briggs

customer_reviews.title: NO LAN PORT and Tackily Stickered up like a Nascar
customer_reviews.text: NO LAN PORT. Not a single USB to LAN adapter works with any LAN devices. Tacky stickered up. Go to peel off stupid tacky looking stickers like this damn thing is a Nascar and adhesive all over and down inside the perforated holes of the top. First day not very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: 2 mo. warranty
customer_reviews.text: Laptop was great when I first got it but within the mo. I started having problems with the fans. I found out that I recieved it with ONLY 2 mo.s left on the warranty. It was suppose to be a new machine and most laptops come with a year warranty. I sent it in for repairs. It worked great! , well for 4mo.s. Now, passed the 2 mo. warranty, the fans run constantly and are extremely loud. The machine is not heating up. It appears to be a problem with the thermal sensor. I imagine it will be quite costly to have it repaired. Very disappointed with all the trouble for a laptop that's 5 mo.s old.
customer_reviews.author: Shen

customer_reviews.title: PUBG 100~140fps
customer_reviews.text: PUBG 100~140fps, after I turned all the visual effects to the lowest. For a laptop, I think it's good enough. The fan's very noisy when in performance mode, I think it's acceptable. The switch of the touchpad (Fn + F10) doesn't work frequently, I contacted the seller and they let me reinstalled 2 drivers. The problem was fixed but happened again the next day. I asked again they gave me the same answer which made me knew that they are not able to fix this problem. It's a software mistake buy the manufacture I think. Overall the laptop is great for gaming and it's thin and light. Worth to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power in such a thin laptop
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this laptop! I love the forward keyboard and since I am right handed, love the touch pad/10 key. The volume wheel is awesome feature as well! I had no screen issues that others mention, it is simply a beautiful display. I am also very happy that the camera is not built into the screen bezel. I'm so happy using this laptop that I have been neglecting my desktop setup. Yes it gets hot... Both the power supply and laptop but the fans speed up as needed. Just make sure your power supply is not covered and you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had too long with this beast, but so far it loads everything extremely fast and has blown all the games I play out of the water. All of the fan and RGB settings are pretty easy to understand and configure at the basic level which is nice for people who don't have a good grasp on these things. The keyboard has definitely taken some getting used to but it's not bad. Haven't tried anything with RTX just yet.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Performance
customer_reviews.text: The laptop's performance is excellent, I am able to run top games at max settings at minimum 60 fps. The design truly helps with cooling, I have experienced little to no thermal throttling even on the most demanding tasks. The design is very appealing too, with a decent track pad. Speakers are good quality for a laptop. The camera comes separated from the laptop but can easily be connected. Overall the laptop is everything you could want, it has the performance of a desktop and is slik and portable.
customer_reviews.author: katalin ambrus

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a quiet computer, keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I expect fan noise while gaming. However, even when doing nothing but wordprocessing, both the CPU AND GPU fan are continuously running in this thing. For this kind of money, don't bother. Yes, you can mess with the settings and manually turn the fan off, but then it starts getting real hot.
customer_reviews.author: bburk

customer_reviews.title: hope you dont plan on playing anything for more than 10 min....
customer_reviews.text: Because this laptop is going to start overheating and thermal throttling almost immediately. Doesnt matter if you have the internal fans turned up to turbo, you will need a stand with fans with another fan blowing directly on the side of the computer to even keep it at 50 fps. I honestly dont know what I was expecting from a gaming laptop, perhaps a computer that could play games.. i dunno
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Upgradable to 40GB memory
customer_reviews.text: Just upgraded to 40G memory. You have 8GB which is smoldered to the board and cannot be changed, and another slot available for a 32G memory. The one i used was Samsung 32GB DDR4 2666MHz RAM Memory Module for Laptop Computers (260 Pin SODIMM, 1.2V) M471A4G43MB1. This way my 531GX has 40G in total.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Liu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I Love everything about this Laptop so far (got it 3 days ago). Edit: Well i Love it a lot less now, i have a left side fan making a lot of noise when i first start it up and the arrow buttons are really hard to get working unless you smash them down totally. =( I just figured that paying $2,600 would get me a good laptop...not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Kenza

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this and all started out well. But after about a week it just up and died on me. I was able to return it with no issues. Over all this would probably be a good gaming laptop but not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Broken Bios
customer_reviews.text: Been a big fan of Asus for years and was loving this computer until they updated the BIOS and now it will not register the rtx2070 graphics card. I'll change my review when they fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Kraygen

customer_reviews.title: Premium price for a premium product!
customer_reviews.text: 5/23/19 Everythings working great out of the box, very powerfull, sound and display is amazing. Will update in 3 - 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I was absolutely impressed with the quality of packaging this product came in. The laptop came in a super nice and unique cardboard box that was secured with some nice foam braces. Everything including the laptop came in very nice packaging. I just got the laptop up and running and so far so good. There is a very tiny amount of back light bleed which is not even noticeable unless youre on a pure black screen. other than that, setup was easy, and so far everything is running smoothly. I'll add more at a later date after further use.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Games fast, no virtual reality edit: yes virtual reality
customer_reviews.text: It's good for gaming I liked it, mine had some problems though so I returned it, the eye in the middle came undone and broke, everything worked perfectly except my period key and the camera it came with. If your getting this for vr though it wont work with main ones like oculus or vive because it doesn't have a mini display port. It will work with hdmi ones thought but they arnt usually high resolution. EDIT: ok turns out I'm stupid, this did support vr, via the USB type c port
customer_reviews.author: Matthew O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: BEST GAMING LAPTOP
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS VERSION OF ZEPHYRUS, THE KEYBOARD FOR GAMING IS SO CONFORTABLE IF YOU HAVE A NICE DESK FOR PLAYING, THE SCREEN SIZE AND COLORS CAN'T BE BETTER.. THIS IS A LAPTOP FOR LIKE 10 YEARS, SO GETTING ONE IS THE BEST INVESTMENT YOU CAN DO FOR LONG TERM.. I am receiving points in the ROG Elite Rewards loyalty program for my review
customer_reviews.author: Gian B.

customer_reviews.title: High quality gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality gaming laptop. Specs work well on most games I play, including Black Desert online. Having said that, the battery life is only good if you are doing anything other than gaming. The high end video card will suck the battery in about an hour, on high graphics settings. Having said that, the battery lasts about 10+ hours if you do anything else. Gaming requires being plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: James Yturralde

customer_reviews.title: Congratulations and Merry Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Bought this computer for dual purpose for my son, gaming and got into 1st choice college... go Green Wave...Merry Christmas He loves it, great for gaming we’ll see about other need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Longo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: You’d think if you spend $2000 on a computer it would work like you want it to but then it can’t even function properly like a normal laptop. I am constantly having problem with the headphone jack, laptop wouldn’t turn on when it’s put to sleep mode. Pressed power button everything, still wouldn’t turn on. So finally I have to hold the power button to manually restart it. This might be a powerful machine, but if it can’t even function properly then it’s a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It's excellent but imperfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is the excellent laptop I've ever seen. But when I open the game, you can hear a little electricity noise. And it doesn't support thunderbolt 3.
customer_reviews.author: Dingirs_k

customer_reviews.title: Laptop battery life fails
customer_reviews.text: The battery (like all laptop battery's) is crap. 2 hours is nothing. Fortunately, I leave my laptop plugged in almost all of the time due to being disabled and stuck in a chair. I wish the backlights for the keypad was a different color than red, also. I don't use a camera, so I didn't rate it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jolley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Product was as good as expected but the outer packing was not in a good shape. Other than that everything is satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: kiwonp

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop i have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Tech has come so far to be able to fit something so powerful in such a small package. Incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Awesome computer but has many flaws
customer_reviews.text: The laptop itself is excellent, good screen and is fast, but in less than a year, the batterry just died, and the left USB C port stop working, its has one on the right, but only the left one can be used with display port.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor servise, product didnt last more than 6 hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: Product started off well but less than a week into use, the monitor started getting glitchy. It now sometimes doesn't come on at all and only works when you lightly tap the side of the monitor. I'm assuming due to a bad internal connection. I would expect a better quality build on a $4,000 laptop. I can't get anyone from this company to respond to my concerns...
customer_reviews.author: Brent Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but work every penny. No flaws in this laptop what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Trystn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but loud
customer_reviews.text: Has been able to handle everything I've thrown at it with high quality video settings without any noticeable issues. This thing can heat up like crazy though and can burn you if you touch the GPU area. When running the fans at 100% it is incredibly loud and any nuance in the audio is lost, essentially mandating a headset.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Weindorf

customer_reviews.title: Good gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: I have had the computer for a month now. So far, it seems very good. I can game everything at high graphics. Only Star citizen is giving me problem. I think the computer can't optimize itself for the game. It's a recommended buy even if it is very expensive. The 1 year warranty makes it a bit safer buy also.
customer_reviews.author: Davidio

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight the laptop is first off and the gaming experience is fantastic have no issues running the games I play. Fan is somewhat quiet but its what you can expect from a laptop for gaming. Overall I give it a 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Subka Davison

customer_reviews.title: I PAY FOR NEW LAPTOP NOT A REFURBISHED ONE !!!
customer_reviews.text: The last one that I had to return was defective even the laptop was brand new and even sealed. Let’s see how this replacement gonna be. Update: try 3rd time with this company. This time, the laptop even make loud noise when it runs. And ofc, it’s refurbished again, not brand new as they advertised. I’m so disappointed, no more business with this company
customer_reviews.author: Edwardp

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, I'm totally in love with this computer!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: works well enough but poor ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: no issues running any games i enjoy but the keyboard location on the front edge of the laptop is rough on the wrists, and the numpad not being tactile and co integrated with the touch pad i detest overall i enjoy the laptop but definitely could use some better design.
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: What SSD should we change?
customer_reviews.text: I got this laptop, going good but I expected a good samsung SSD, when I try to check what SSD, is one that I have no idea, I was wondering changing to a let's say Samsung Evo 970 Plus 1TB would greatly increase time and efficiency? Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Pedro S.

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased with this at all
customer_reviews.text: Graphics card suddenly stopped working after updates or something. Cannot do any gaming. I am furious.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Backlight Issues
customer_reviews.text: Screen has sectional backlighting problems, for example watching a move, sections of the screen would be brighter in just a section length of the screen top to bottom 1/6 of the screen at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin LaBuda

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ITEM DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: THIS DOES NOT HAVE AN RTX 2080 GPU. THE LAPTOP THEY SOLD ME HAS AN RTX 2080 MAX-Q DESIGN.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: The perfect 17ich Laptop
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect gaming laptop, also it’s portable. Use it most for editing in Adobe or Rhino.. works well playing battle field max setting on 210fps
customer_reviews.author: Peace Lawal

customer_reviews.title: week later and it would have been cheaper.....sigh
customer_reviews.text: week later and it would have been cheaper.....sigh but good machine
customer_reviews.author: Thundar

customer_reviews.title: battery drain after first month of usage
customer_reviews.text: Great Thermals. However, the battery starts draining significantly after the month of usage. The battery report shows that the product is designed for 75,000 mWh, and it's now at 52,000 mWh.
customer_reviews.author: Diyi Liu

customer_reviews.title: Materials and built quality are UltraPremium! gaming performance outofspace
customer_reviews.text: The best experience with a laptop I ever had, call me outdated but i only miss a blue ray reader
customer_reviews.author: MARCOS ANZOLA

customer_reviews.title: SCAMMMMM!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the GTX 2070 edition but the graphics card in it is a Intel(r) UHD 630. Which can barely run Castle Crashers. I was deployed when I got it so now 6 months has passed and can't get a refund
customer_reviews.author: Al Sahim

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming laptop but...
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming, however gets hot and the fan is loud even in silent mode. Overall I dont regret my purchase and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Nikln90

customer_reviews.title: The product support sucks, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: ASUS ROG support is unable to deal with any issue you may have. Don't buy this computer unless you're an expert in computer of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: sixuan gu

customer_reviews.title: Portable gaming
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming laptop I have owned. I like the keyboard forward, and soon got used to the right hand touch pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great everything except battery
customer_reviews.text: Great performance, design and screen. Fits into 15inch laptop neoprene. Premium feel and materials.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Simple but tylish design
customer_reviews.text: just received, package is well protected, very stylish, l will use it for some time to see how it works
customer_reviews.author: Xin Kong

customer_reviews.title: Fast solid laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great all around lap top great graphics does everything well.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG Zephyrus S GX701 Gaming Laptop, 17.3” 144Hz Pantone Validated Full HD IPS, GeForce RTX 2080, Intel Core i7-8750H CPU, 16GB DDR4, 1TB PCIe NVME SSD Hyper Drive, Windows 10 Pro-GX701GX-XS76
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Single| Style:RTX 2080 | 144HzRog Zephyrus s set the standard for ultra-slim Windows 10 Pro Gaming laptops featuring up to NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 graphics. Boasting a 144Hz refresh rate pantone validated display with ultra-narrow bezel, PCIe NVMe SSD, and an 8th Gen Intel Core i7 processor, the new GX701 has all the power and portability needed to conquer the latest and greatest game titles, anywhere. Use the ROG-exclusive GPU switch to change between G-SYNC for gaming and Optimus for battery life while the ROG active aerodynamic System (AAs) expands to help Zephyrus s sustain top performance for gaming and other heavy loads. *The actual transfer speed of USB 3.0, 3.1 (Gen 1 and 2), and/or Type-C will vary depending on many factors including the processing speed of the host device, file attributes and other factors related to system configuration and your operating environment.
feature_bullets: Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 8GB GDDR6 (base: 990 MHz, Boost: 1230 MHz; TDP: 90W)
Intel Core i7 8750H Hexa Core processor
17.3” 144Hz 3ms Pantone validated FHD display with NVIDIA G SYNC
16GB DDR4 2666MHz RAM | 1TB NVMe PCIe SSD (Hyper drive) | Windows 10 Professional
Smaller than standard form Factor only 0.74” (18.7 millimeter) thin
Reduced temperature compared to conventional cooling design Due to ROG exclusive active Aerodynamic system and 12V fans. Increased longevity with anti dust technology
Gpu switch mode: Switch between integrated and discrete graphics for increased battery life or powerful gaming performance
Per key aura Sync RGB keyboard with separate volume roll key

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars182 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
